column4: Simple question, if you choose TLS security in Evolution, is mail still sent on port 25? Or does it use another port for TLS encrypted connections?
does your outgoing email even use any form of authentication?
Yeah, it supports TLS encryption, but I'm not sure what port TLS encrypted mail is supposed to be sent on
I maintain the mail server, so I might need to open some extra ports on the firewall :)
usually most email encryption things deal only with first hop & authentication for that - rest goes unencrypted
I understand that. Do you know if email sent via SMTP + TLS is sent on port 25 or a different port? Like http is 80 but https is not...
the answer is: it depends - after http people decided it would be better to just use the same port...
but there are ports that are used for several ssl email protocols, some of the time - check /etc/services
Ok, cool, so it can work on the same port, that's probably why my mail can't send, ISP blocks port 25, bah :(
well when ISP blocks port 25 they usually supply an smtp server you're supposed to use as the first hop...
I know, I travel a lot though, so I prefer to use my own smtp server, authenticated
Which also matches my SPF record, etc
I typically wrap evolution in a tsocks tunnel, but I'm looking at alternatives to that, looks like the port 25 issue won't go away any time soon :)
the percentage of ISPs blocking port 25 is high - your best bet is proper hosting service
What do you mean by "proper hosting service" ?
have an email server running at a hosting service, tunnel to that way or another
but you said you already have such a server somewhere? Try port 465?
I admin my own mailserver. Postfix is running but doesn't respond on port 465
Hmm... you could check which ports you're listening to... also check out the ssmtp package
How do I check which ports I'm listening to?
netstat -an; lsof -i  # you might want to check out postfix TLS docs, http://www.postfix.org/TLS_README.html
Sweet, thanks for that link :)
